page.topic: Getting and Setting the Value of a Slider Control
page.description: The value for a Slider Control can be set using javascript.

section.title: Setting the Value for a Slider Control
section.description: The Slider Control is a Data Control. The value can be set for all Data Controls using the *[js:{dialog.object}.setValue]* method. For single value sliders, setting the value is straightforward. For a two value slider, you must pass in an array that defines the start and end value for the slider. See examples below:

section.title: Getting the Value for a Slider Control
section.description: As with setting the value, you can use *[js:{dialog.object}.getValue]* to get the value from a Slider Control. getValue will return the value for a single value slider as expected:
section.example: var value = {dialog.object}.getValue('S1'); alert("Slider value is: " + value);

section.description: For a two value slider, *[js:{dialog.object}.getValue]* will return a string with the format "start..end". If you wanted to set the value in a two value slider with the current value in another two value slider, you would need to convert the string to an array:
